body:
> filer_file should read as filter_file

:rofl: 

> I think that, long term, this caching mechanic would be more elegantly (and more stably) implemented with joblib.Memory

unclear to me whether that is good, since joblib saves anonymous hashes, whereas since we know all the parameters that go into filter generation, we can write informative filenames

> and that the calls to print could be replaced by logging

yeah probably a good idea as a general policy. takes some learning though and some decisions

I think I agree with @eickenberg . Long term will decide which solution to chose, for now I believe it's ok; feel free to open a new issue later.(I prefer several issues with single problems rather than several problems into one issue)

issue.title: FIX caching was not usable + missing library to import

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
closes #175
the function filter_bank_real no longer exists
filter_bank does what filter_bank_real used to do and does not cache the filters
+ some docstring and PEP8 improvements
